GaN is Boron Nitride-like structured and crystallizes in the hexagonal P6_3/mmc space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of two GaN sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. Ga(1) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Ga(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.85 Å. N(1) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to three equivalent Ga(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.9819 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.31649339937500004 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

GaN is Moissanite-4H structured and crystallizes in the hexagonal P6_3mc space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of two GaN sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are two inequivalent Ga sites. In the first Ga site, Ga(1) is bonded to one N(2) and three equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing GaN4 tetrahedra. The Ga(1)-N(2) bond length is 2.00 Å. All Ga(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.95 Å. In the second Ga site, Ga(2) is bonded in a trigonal non-coplanar geometry to three equivalent N(2) atoms. All Ga(2)-N(2) bond lengths are 1.94 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded in a trigonal non-coplanar geometry to three equivalent Ga(1) atoms. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to one Ga(1) and three equivalent Ga(2) atoms to form corner-sharing NGa4 tetrahedra.
